title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: General equations of heat, mass and momentum balance, laminar, turbulent flow, concept of boundary layer, friction factor, heat and mass transfer coefficients and dimensionless correlations. Mathematical model: model formulation with governing equations, boundary conditions, some case studies of some important metallurgical system: packed and fluidized bed, moving boundary problems with melting, solidifications and reactions, interaction of gas bubbles and jets with liquid. Numerical methods: control volume method for solving partial differential equations. Numerical solutions of some metallurgical processes: gas stirred ladle, filling ladle, fusion welding, cored wire injection, soaking pits, continuous casting etc.
